reference.shortdesc: The choption element describes an option that a user could choose to accomplish a step of a task. In a user interface, for example, this might be the name of radio button.

draft-comment.author: Kristen Eberlein
draft-comment.p: The short description should make it clear that this element is only available within a choice table.

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: <step><cmd>Then this</cmd> <choicetable> <chhead> <choptionhd>Do something</choptionhd> <chdeschd>And this happens</chdeschd> </chhead> <chrow><choption>Do this</choption> <chdesc>and this will happen</chdesc></chrow> <chrow><choption>Do that</choption> <chdesc>and that will happen</chdesc></chrow> </choicetable> </step>
